etymology.description: 𠨍 (“two people facing each other”) + 皀 (“round-mouthed food vessel”) → 饗 ‘to feast’; ‘village’ sense via phonetic borrowing/semantic shift.
etymology.interpretation: Originally evoked two people sharing a vessel in a ritual feast, a scene central to communal life. Through semantic shift it came to mean a community or village; the simplified 乡 preserves only a streamlined outline of the older graph.
etymology.simplification: Graphic abbreviation of 鄉 by removing the right-hand 良-like component (historically from 皀) and compressing strokes for economy.

examples.chinese: 我们回到家乡(我們回到家鄉)。
这个乡镇很安静(這個鄉鎮很安靜)。
他身上还有些乡气(他身上還有些鄉氣)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shēnshang hái yǒu xiē xiāngqì.
examples.english: He still has a bit of rustic air.
